metadata.title: CVE-2022-1016 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel innet/netfilter/nf_tables_core.c:nft_do_chain, which can cause ause-after-free. This issue needs to handle 'return' with properpreconditions, as it can lead to a kernel information leak problem causedby a local, unprivileged attacker.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1016` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-27-generic - 5.15.0-27.28
linux-image-5.15.0-27-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-27.28
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-27-generic - 5.15.0-27.28
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-27-generic-64k - 5.15.0-27.28
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1005-kvm - 5.15.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1005-aws - 5.15.0-1005.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1005-azure - 5.15.0-1005.6
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-5.15.0-1006-raspi - 5.15.0-1006.6

No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-27-lowlatency - 5.15.0-27.28

No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1008-intel-iotg - 5.15.0-1008.11
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-27.28').
linux-kvm package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1005.5').
linux-aws package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1005.7').
linux-azure package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1005.6').
linux-azure-fde package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
linux-gcp package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1004.7').
linux-gke package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1003.3').
linux-gkeop package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1001.2').
linux-ibm package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1003.3').
linux-oracle package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1003.5').
linux-raspi package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1006.6').
linux-lowlatency package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-27.28').
linux-oem-5.17 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.17.0-1004.4').
linux-intel-iotg package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1008.11').
linux-oem-6.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-oem-6.1, was needs-triage').
